ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: During the last week, how often did your baby: make talking sounds when s/he was ready for more food?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply

ElementDescription: During the last week, how often did your baby: seem angry (crying and fussing) when you left her/him in the crib?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: During the last week, how often did your baby: seem contented when left in the crib?

Notes: Mean of effortful control scale items; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: In the last week: When introduced to an unfamiliar adult, how often did the baby never warm up to the unfamiliar adult?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: In the last week: When singing or talking to your baby, how often did they take more than 10 minutes to soothe?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: In the last week: When in the presence of several unfamiliar adults, how often did the baby continue to be upset for 10 minutes or longer?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: In the last week: When the baby wanted something, how often did they have tantrums (crying, screaming, face red, etc.) when they did not get what they wanted?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: In the last week: When rocking your baby, how often did they take more than 10 minutes to soothe?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: In the last week: When visiting a new place, how often did your baby get excited about exploring new surroundings?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: In the last week: When an unfamiliar person came to your home or apartment, how often did your baby cry when the visitor attempted to pick them up?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: In the last week: When introduced to an unfamiliar adult, how often did the baby cling to a parent?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: In the last week: When patting or gently rubbing some part of the baby's body, how often did they take more than 10 minutes to soothe?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: In the last week: When showing the baby something to look at, how often did they take more than 10 minutes to soothe?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: In the last week: While being fed in your lap, how often did the baby seem eager to get away as soon as the feeding was over? (Reverse-coded)
Notes: Note item is reverse-coded; 1=Always; 2=Almost Always; 3=More than half the time; 4=About half the time; 5=Less than half the time; 6=Very Rarely; 7=Never; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: In the last week: When singing or talking to your baby, how often did they soothe immediately?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: In the last week: When showing the baby something to look at, how often did they soothe immediately?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing

ElementDescription: In the last week: When introduced to an unfamiliar adult, how often did the baby refuse to go to the unfamiliar person?
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Very Rarely; 3=Less than Half the Time; 4=About Half the Time; 5=More than Half the Time; 6=Almost Always; 7=Always; -9=Does Not Apply; -10=Missing
